website_summaries.verdict: Finding a decent first aid kit for a camping trip can be challenging, but the Coleman First Aid Kit does fit that bill. It is a great budget kit and will get the job done for 98% of all use cases.
pros: Contains 205 pieces of hospital grade bandages, ointments and survival gear
Very light, so it is easily portable
Ideal for camping or other expedition trips
cons: Very basic selection of emergency medical items, not an EMT-level kit
The contents are very tightly packed so organization is key in making sure they all fit

customer_reviews.title: Very complete but...
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these to keep in my vehicle a year or two ago and after a move this summer I realized I lost my house first aid kit so I ordered another one of these. Never had a need to use one until recently and I discovered the band aids just don't stick well at all. I had cut myself on my hand so it wasn't an arm or anywhere with lots of hair either. You do get a lot of bandages but I'll probably end up having to replace them with a better brand before things pick up in the spring/summer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D.

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT up to Amazon standards
customer_reviews.text: This TINY "kit" has maybe $5 worth of stuff in it. The "kit" is 5-1/2" x 2" x 7-1/4". It has no large bandages, and would be worthless if you were trying to offer serious first aid in case of a road accident. Do yourself a favor: Hurry to your local pharmacy and buy a proper first aid kit--OR, buy the pieces and parts and make your own. That's what we plan to do.
customer_reviews.author: TruthSeeker

customer_reviews.title: Not a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I would have thought Coleman would have put out a better product. This case is very small and looks like someone just threw in a bunch of bandaids. I tried to return it but was told there was no return on this product. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Gullyfisher@aol.com

customer_reviews.title: The products seem very quality as well but like some bandages that will fall off in the water
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised with just how much stuff they packed in this little box. I got a few this for our boat and it'll have almost everything we need. I did add a couple packets of sugar (some family members have diabetes) and some After Bite which even will all the contents there was still room to add. The products seem very quality as well but like some bandages that will fall off in the water.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Greenleaf

customer_reviews.title: compact, cute and necessary if you are going camping ...
customer_reviews.text: compact, cute and necessary if you are going camping or want this in a car just in case of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky L.

customer_reviews.title: Do t leave home without one...
customer_reviews.text: Good starting point for a travel first aid kit. The carry case is semi rigid so that's good for the contents but bad for space saving when packing. There's extra room to add stuff too so that helps a lot...
customer_reviews.author: HonkyLips

customer_reviews.title: Good Value Emergency First Aid kit
customer_reviews.text: Very well stocked First Aid Kit. I also purchased some other Gauze and Bandage items for a Home Emergency kit. I also purchased a 14-inch duffel to store this and some other larger Ace Bandage Wraps and Bulk Assorted Pads and Bandages and Disinfectant.
customer_reviews.author: Badboytim

customer_reviews.title: Convenient size, but missing a few essentials.
customer_reviews.text: It's a convenient size and light enough to stow in your car or rake with you on a camping trip, but for a First Aid kit that is marketed for longer teips, especially coming from a respected company like Coleman, it's missing a few items that I consider critical: *There are no gauze wraps, in either 2" or 4", *It only has 2"×2" gauze pads, no 4"×4", *It has no triangular bandages, which are needed to make slings, which I would certainly want out in the wilderness. If you buy this, I would buy some extra stand-alone items to supplement what the kit is missing.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great size for storing under the seat in my vehicle
customer_reviews.text: Great size for storing under the seat in my vehicle. I keep this along with a trauma pack with a quick clot sponge. Seems to be reasonably well stocked, but thankfully I have not had to use it in any kind of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: ProGrit Sanding Sponges

customer_reviews.title: uncomfortable thick bandaids that sometimes stick sometimes don't
customer_reviews.text: I will stick with Nexcare bandaids. The kit was complete and had a nice case but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: John (Michigan)

customer_reviews.title: No need to worry
customer_reviews.text: I was a little worried when I read some of the reviews, but it has great variety of basic stuff, and it all fits in the case with ease. I even found it has a little room to fit a few extra things you might want to add, unlike what a other reviewer said. I'm very happy with this basic little first aid kit, and impressed with how much is actually in it.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey wlihelm

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for a new first aid kit to replace the old one we had in our truck. I love the fact of how small it is and how easy it is to organize. I like the fact that now if anything happens we are better prepared for any emergency that comes our way. I would say this should have an emergency blanket but I already have one from our old first aid kit that we had in North Dakota.
customer_reviews.author: MarthaTXN

customer_reviews.title: Has almost everything I need for a family or scout ...
customer_reviews.text: Has almost everything I need for a family or scout camping weekend. Supplemented with some scissors, blister care and some clotting gauze. Hopefully I won't ever have to use any of it.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: Good Kit
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car and have used the bandages in it a few times. It has everything that I think would be needed for an emergency. Its been in the car for two years and has not broken down from the extreme heat.
customer_reviews.author: Tracie L

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking/camping!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great, compact first aid kit. We purchased this for a hiking trip, and it fit well in a backpack without taking up too much space. It has everything you'd need for minor injuries/ailments - except it does NOT have a scissors. We did add one to ours. The case is sturdy and protects its contents.
customer_reviews.author: johnny

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: I needed a gift for someone who really likes practical gifts. This is about the size of a hotel room telephone. The kit I bought will be stored in the trunk of a car until needed. It's small enough that you can store it pretty much anywhere. I recommend this, especially as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Fatelvis

customer_reviews.title: Ouch!!!
customer_reviews.text: We were going to "make up" a First Aid Kit, then we seen this and we had almost everything we wanted. It is a super package; we added type of cut heal powder that the wife picked up. It is well worth the money to get this complete packet.
customer_reviews.author: Toyboy

customer_reviews.title: Great! Has everything we need and the case is ...
customer_reviews.text: Great! Has everything we need and the case is really nice. Not super huge so it will be easy to store in a closet or in a bathroom drawer or something. Had to use a bandage from it the other day, but hopefully that's the last time we'll have to use it anytime soon. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Bunny B

customer_reviews.title: A great gift for your young adult offspring
customer_reviews.text: A great gift for your young adult offspring who would never think of buying and keeping one in their car. The 205 piece kit contains just about anything needed for minor first aid. It fits easily in any one of several places in your car or back pack. It really is a must-have.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Z

customer_reviews.title: Average.
customer_reviews.text: Average. The product isn't what I expected. I could have bought different sizes of gauze, bandaid, gloves, ibuprofen...etc to put this kit together myself. The antibiotic ointment comes in little package and cannot be resealed after single use.
customer_reviews.author: Fanny

customer_reviews.title: Love the little suitcase type kit
customer_reviews.text: A+ First Aid Kit. Love the little suitcase type kit. I like with all that it comes. However, I added a few things I maybe will find handy in an emergency situation. - To be honest.... I stuffed it....LOL.....and thanks to the great suitcase type of kit I was able to do so and still closed the zipper. Would recommend this to anyone. TYSM.
customer_reviews.author: Maria K. Young

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking, light weight, most of the essentials
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had the chance to use this in a real emergency (thankfully), I have opened it and even tested a band-aid. The materials feel nice and the packaging is well labeled.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Ummm...not much to say...
customer_reviews.text: Meh...a lot of stuff of questionable use, but ok to throw in the truck for the odd skinned knuckle and small cut...but it will not support any serious trauma repair or reduction. In retrospect, I should have purchased a military-style platoon level trauma kit...oh well. This kit is fine as long as you realize it is only for VERY minor superficial nicks and scrapes.
customer_reviews.author: B. Rose

customer_reviews.title: this was a much better way to have everything and not all spread out ...
customer_reviews.text: compact and includes everything. I bought this for my fiancé because he does parkour and always keeps bandaids and neosporin on his bag just in case. this was a much better way to have everything and not all spread out in the bottom of his bag. it is easy to keep organized and very lightweight for easy carrying.
customer_reviews.author: Jessi P

customer_reviews.title: Very nice kit, awesome case
customer_reviews.text: Awesome case, lots of bandages, tweezers were cool but disposable my only problem was that it comes with gloves that are not wrapped, they are just floating around the cases so they aren't sterile if that bothers you, you can just replace them, but this is a great kit
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: iTS A FANCY BOX OF DIFFERENT SIZE BAND AIDS BASICALLY !
customer_reviews.text: yOU COULD DO THIS ASSORTMENT MUCH CHEAPER ON YOUR OWN .

customer_reviews.title: Looks to be full of the basics. I hope ...
customer_reviews.text: Looks to be full of the basics. I hope to never use it, but it's a convenient set for in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Clay

customer_reviews.title: This first aid kid has everything you need. Seriously.
customer_reviews.text: This first aid kit has everything in it! From medical gloves to heat packs. The kit is also very light and mobile, you can travel with this or keep it at home. I would trust this first aid kit during a natural disaster and I live in San Francisco, the earthquake city.

customer_reviews.title: Very good kit - Has all the essentials !

customer_reviews.text: Doesn't include a whole lot other very cheap materials. Would be better off buying 20 first aid kits from the dollar store lol

customer_reviews.title: This this is a nice, compact first-aid kit
customer_reviews.text: This this is a nice, compact first-aid kit. For some reason, I thought it was going to be bigger, but it's about the size of an over-sized paper-back book. I guess that makes it more portable and easier to store.

customer_reviews.title: Better than the cheap Wal Mart ones and just as ...
customer_reviews.text: Has everything you need for a first aid kit. Better than the cheap Wal Mart ones and just as cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Duran

customer_reviews.title: Good starter kit
customer_reviews.text: Good starter kit, need to add to the kit to make it right. This kit has 50 1" x 1/4" band aids that I took out and tossed, useless just to make the piece count higher.
customer_reviews.author: GCR1969

customer_reviews.title: It has a lot of goodies for not a lot of dollars.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this to pack in my offshore bag. It has a lot of goodies for not a lot of dollars. The case is hard sided so your stuff doesn't get mushed. Nearly everything inside is useful, not a lot of filler. I'm confident that for any first aid needs, this would have what you need.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Great kit
customer_reviews.text: Great kit with room to add additional meds. Compact size & soft case carries what's needed for simple camping needs.

customer_reviews.title: good enough for minor injuries.

customer_reviews.author: Yellow J

customer_reviews.title: This is only good for miner cut and things
customer_reviews.text: ok 2 stars are all I can give it because the zipper broke the first time I opened it. but the name Expedition is a over statement. This is only good for miner cut and things. I can't say anything good about the case it is just crap.
customer_reviews.author: colcec

customer_reviews.title: Great kit.
customer_reviews.text: Band-aids for days. If you have this kit on hand and can't close a non-fatal wound then you're doing something wrong. Great kit.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit, but everything is crammed in
customer_reviews.text: Great kit, but everything is crammed in. We used it once and it was really hard to jam it all back in. Hopefully you don't have to use this often, but if you're anticipating using some of the items frequently, I'd buy them separately.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: Everything you need to travel outside eg hiking or travelling, good for health protection.

customer_reviews.title: Little Boys are Not for the Faint Hearted!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME kit full of all needs for when you have a little toddler! My son is Mr. Jump-off-the-couch and Run-in-to-the-table resulting in all sorts of cuts and scrapes and this has yet to fail me on a need.

customer_reviews.title: Mostly band aids
customer_reviews.text: This has a variety of band aids and some room to add additional items to make complete. IE compression bandages, blood stopping pads, sewing, ace bandage and gauze, etc. Great as is for cuts and scrapes, minor boo boos kids will get.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to grab and go

customer_reviews.title: Eh it's ok

Everything about this appears generic and crappily made. I will probably ditch most of the products in this and add my own. Good thing I had a gift card for this purchase. Would not recommend this. Would be better off spending more $ and building your own to be perfectly honest
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... aid kit really has everything it's going to work great we needed something we could zip up and take ...
customer_reviews.text: This first aid kit really has everything it's going to work great we needed something we could zip up and take with us on camping trips and this will do the job
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Stage

customer_reviews.title: Decent kit, has items you would need for most situations
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Soft and sturdy case, neatly organized, has most commonly used items Cons: None This is a great first aid kit for camping/backpacking, an emergency kit, or home/office kit. I noticed that it is missing disinfecting wipes, which is something that would be useful when running water isn't available for cleaning a wound. Upon further research, I think most first aid kids actually don't have any, so I can't dock any points here. The plastic tweezer is not very useful, but most kits only have plastic ones because they're cheap. Overall, it's a decent kit, and you can always add a few items to complete it.
customer_reviews.author: PLinTop Contributor: Watches

customer_reviews.title: I love the kit
customer_reviews.text: I love the kit. It comes with everything you may possibly need in an emergency. They even have gloves for safety!

customer_reviews.title: I love the concept of having a small and compact kit ...
customer_reviews.text: I love the concept of having a small and compact kit in the car. It came with a large variety of items for the price. Unfortunately the bandaids just slide off and don't do their job well. The case is very sturdy and holds a lot of items.

customer_reviews.title: Not What I thought! A ton of Band-Aids
customer_reviews.text: This is not a great first-aid kit. It is basically a ton of band aids.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the office or car
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for the office or car. I really don't want to think about what to put in a first aid kit. This made my life easy and I use it. plus, the red color makes it easy to find in the car or the office closet.
customer_reviews.author: BentoMommy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT!

customer_reviews.title: i feel that having a first aid kit is a ...
customer_reviews.text: i feel that having a first aid kit is a must in just about any room. i try to have one in every place i have in the house and the car.thank you

customer_reviews.text: It was exactly what we were looking for. For hiking the boat and for the car. Basic stuff needed in the kit.

customer_reviews.title: I bought 6 of them
customer_reviews.text: A must have in your backpack or car, I bought 6 of them

customer_reviews.text: great size first aid kit for the car or just to have handy in the kitchen. has everything in it that would be needed in a small emergency.

customer_reviews.title: I recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little medkit. Small but enough in there to help out. Fits perfectly in my belt pouch.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony D. Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Solid!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't have burn cream, which would be nice, but it does have a lot of other things you need, without all the random unnecessary things you sometime find in these first aid kits.

customer_reviews.title: No alcohol pads on this kit
customer_reviews.text: Only 2 star because it didn't have alcohol pads you need to add alcohol pads too!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Bazurto

customer_reviews.title: All the bandaids are latex-free (which is great if you're allergic
customer_reviews.text: All the bandaids are latex-free (which is great if you're allergic, i suppose), and are, unfortunately, incredibly cheap. They stay on for about ten minutes. I'm tempted to dump the contents and just use the shell for my kit, but it seems a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Smolenski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kit to take on a road trip
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a 4x4 trip and luckily didn't need to use it, but it's a well-assembled kit with common items that my be needed in a variety of emergiencies.

customer_reviews.title: Has everything advertised and the case is good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaper then in the store. Has everything advertised and the case is good quality.

customer_reviews.title: but it ended up having a lot of good supplies in it
customer_reviews.text: I got this mostly for the case and was just going to stock it with my own selection, but it ended up having a lot of good supplies in it. still had plastic band aids though.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Harder

customer_reviews.title: Cant go wront
customer_reviews.text: Good kit for the car. I added a few things but overall good group of stuff at a good price inside a nice case

customer_reviews.title: This is a good set, with a little extra space for things ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good set, with a little extra space for things like extra pills, a few sheets of "Nasal-cease" bleeding pads, some moleskin. I like the semi-rigid case, which makes it very easy to locate.

customer_reviews.title: Not the worst- but certainly no worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Careful- The kits are extreme small in size and really don't pack anything but the very basic's. You would be better off building your own kit for the price.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic First Aid Kit!
customer_reviews.text: Great Set of First Aid Kit. Perfect for to store in the car for emergencies, but don't use the ice pack more than once. Make sure you get rid of that ice pack after one use.

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect little kit for camping. Has a little bit of everything. All I added was bug spray and some extra sting relief.
customer_reviews.author: KJH

customer_reviews.title: Small lots of stuff
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty small so it works well in kayak. Has lots of stuff. So far I haven't had to use anything inside of it.

customer_reviews.title: Great kit. Only one pair of gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great kit. Only one pair of gloves, seems to "skimp" on full size bandaids, but plenty of small ones...

customer_reviews.title: great portable kit
customer_reviews.text: fortunently have not had to use any of this yet. i carry this on hiking/camping/canoeing trips. its compact and light. great portable kit. would recommend

customer_reviews.title: Excellent kit!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of band aids, exactly what my son needed on the construction site.

customer_reviews.text: Nice kit, plenty of bandages and other small pieces, but it is smaller than I thought it would be. I added my own items to boost it up for long car trips. Not bad value for the money but I would like o see a pair of scissors in the kit.

customer_reviews.text: It's a great compact first aid kit. I was hoping for something a little larger but it has many of your essentials. Great size for vehicle or camping.

customer_reviews.text: Good size to tuck into a hiking backpack and comes with a wide variety of stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great basic build on emergency kit!
customer_reviews.text: Great deal on basic kit, good start off for emergency kit!

customer_reviews.title: A lot smaller than I expected, but has what ...
customer_reviews.text: A lot smaller than I expected, but has what I wanted in it. So I gave it 4/5, although really it could be 5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Matt B.

customer_reviews.title: good kit for a good price
customer_reviews.text: good basic first aid kit, although many of the items are tiny bandaids and popsicle sticks to pad the "piece" count.

customer_reviews.title: Hope I do not have to use it but great to have
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our RV. Hope I do not have to use it but great to have.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Shoenfelt

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit, some contents need updating by buyer.
customer_reviews.text: Okay kit, but after using it during a moderately serious fall, I removed and replaced some of the contents. Lousy quality adhesive tape went out and was replaced by more high tech stretchy type, added some polysporin. Removed and replaced the old fashioned bandaids with good quality name brand ones that don't turn your skin wrinkly white, and some better gauze pads. I didn't mind the extra purchases, because it is a nice little kit. Just open it and look over the contents and add and subtract BEFORE YOU NEED IT.
customer_reviews.author: Deadeye

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size to carry in our car. Thankfully have not need to use it yet

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Have this in my car because you never know. Hope it'll serve it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the car!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in car at all times incase of an emergency. Thankful no emergencies yet! But the pack is small enough to fit in my cargo area by my spare tire in my Subaru Forester.

customer_reviews.title: Small first aid kit.

product_meta.title: Coleman Camping All Purpose First Aid Essentials Kit for Emergencies - 205 Pieces
product_meta.description: Tackle the great outdoors and be prepared for any outdoor emergency with this Coleman All Purpose First Aid Essentials Kit. This organized first aid box packs in 205 pieces of the most common first aid supplies, from latex free bandages to triple antibiotic ointment packets to a cold pack, and keeps the camping medical kit all easily accessible. The durable, semi-hard emergency first aid kit case makes it the perfect travel first aid kit, so throw the emergency medical kit in your backpack or sports bag and head out on an adventure. This outdoor emergency kit is a great first aid kit for car travel and accommodates longer trips or larger groups. This camping first aid kit packs in all the essentials for your emergency preparedness needs, making it the perfect essential first aid kit for any use.
feature_bullets: One 205-piece Coleman Camping All Purpose First Aid Essentials Kit for Emergencies
Organized first aid box with outdoor emergency kit essentials provides fast and easy access when needed
Camping first aid kit stocked with the most commonly used first aid supplies, including triple antibiotic ointment packets and latex free bandages
Emergency first aid kit comes in a durable, semi-hard case making this essential first aid kit the perfect travel first aid kit
Great camping medical kit or emergency medical kit for car travel as it can accommodate longer trips or larger groups

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item is not eligible for international shipping.
